titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sparrow Papers MSS.096
titlestmt.author: Matt Moore

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-01 09:57:14 -0500.

change.item: Updated to reflect incorporation of materials from former series "Accretion 1999" and accession 2013.096 into Series III.
Record updated by Rachel Searcy to reflect 2024 accretion

physdesc.extent: in 5 boxes, 1 manuscript box, and 1 half manuscript box

did.abstract: Sparrow is a longtime poet/activist/musician of the Lower East Side of Manhattan and a member of the literary group, the Unbearables. He has published several chapbooks of poetry in collaboration with the St. Mark's Poetry Project and other poetry organizations, and he has served as the editor for the literary journal Big Fish. He has been published in The New Yorker, as well as The Quarterly, and The New York Times. The Sparrow Papers are a diverse collection of materials including manuscripts, notes, journals, travelogues, handwritten signs, and periodicals.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite, and advance notice is required for use. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased from Sparrow in 1999. Sparrow donated further accretions in 2008, 2013, and December 2023. The accession numbers associated with these acquisitions are 1999.096, 2008.096, 2013.096, and 2024.008.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged alphabetically by subject/author heading.
The files are grouped into four series.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Sparrow is a longtime poet/activist of the Lower East Side of Manhattan. He has published several chapbooks of poetry in collaboration with the St. Mark's Poetry Project and other poetry organizations, and he has served as the editor for the literary journal Big Fish. He gained notoriety in 1995 by picketing The New Yorker, holding a sign that read, "My poetry is as bad as yours." Since then, he has been published in that magazine as well as The Quarterly and The New York Times. In 1996, he ran for president and published the book Republican Like Me: A Diary of My Presidential Campaign about his experiences. In addition to his work as a poet, Sparrow is a member of the Unbearables (along with Ron Kolm, Richard Kostelanetz, and Rob Witz), and the founder of the East Village Militia and the One Size Fits All Movement. He is also a member of the musical group Foamola.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Sparrow Papers; MSS 096; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For more information see the Ron Kolm Papers (MSS 079), the Richard Kostelanetz Papers (MSS 089), and the Rob Witz Papers (MSS 080) in Fales Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Sparrow Papers are a diverse collection of materials including manuscripts, notes, journals, travelogues, handwritten signs, and periodicals.

The manuscripts are in the form of typescripts (some with corrections) or handwritten notes, most pertaining to an unidentified novel and are labeled as such. The collection also includes journals and travelogues detailing Sparrow's travels and including notes and drafts of original poetry and fiction. Sparrow's other the personal files in the collection include articles, correspondence, information on Foamola, the New Yorker occupation, and the East Village Militia, and miscellaneous travel documents. The published material within the collection is from Sparrow's collection of periodicals, books, and chapbooks. Published books and chapbooks written by Sparrow have been catalogued and are located within the downtown collection at Fales Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2024 are unknown. In 2024, an accretion of poetry manuscripts and ephemera was rehoused in archival folders, and intellectually incorporated into the collection's Series I. as Box 7.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series I contains the manuscript files of Sparrow's poetry and fiction, most of which are in the form of typescripts (some with corrections) or handwritten notes. A large number of these files are manuscript fragments pertaining to an unidentified novel and are labeled as such. The author's original grouping of manuscript fragments is maintained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series II contains journals and travelogues detailing Sparrow's journeys in Europe and India. Interspersed with the autobiographical information in these journals are notes and drafts of original poetry and fiction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series III contains the personal files, which include articles, correspondence, information on Foamola, the New Yorker occupation, and the East Village Militia, and miscellaneous travel documents.

The True Story of How I Went Punk, Crumbs From My Cabana, drawings, drafts, notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series IV contains Sparrow's collection of periodicals, books, and chapbooks. Published books and chapbooks written by Sparrow have been catalogued and are located within the downtown collection at Fales Library.
